articles.author: Kyle Wiggers
articles.title: OpenAI’s Sora appears to have leaked - TechCrunch
articles.description: A group of artists appears to have leaked access to Sora, OpenAI's video generator, in protest of what they're calling duplicity and "art washing" on OpenAI's part.
articles.content:
A group appears to have leaked access to Sora, OpenAI’s video generator, in protest of what they’re calling duplicity and “art washing” on OpenAI’s part.
On Tuesday, the group published a project on… [+4716 chars]

articles.author: Samuel Axon
articles.title: Are any of Apple’s official MagSafe accessories worth buying? - Ars Technica
articles.description: When MagSafe was introduced, it promised an accessories revolution. Meh.

articles.author: Melissa Repko
articles.title: Best Buy cuts full-year sales forecast due to softer demand for consumer electronics - CNBC
articles.description: Best Buy is waiting for a wave of shoppers to replace old devices and upgrade to new, higher-tech ones after an approximately two-year sales slump.
articles.content: Best Buy on Tuesday cut its full-year sales forecast and missed Wall Street's quarterly revenue expectations, as early holiday shopping and a fresh batch of iPhones and AI-enabled laptops weren't eno… [+4579 chars]

articles.author: Meredith Whittaker
articles.title: The Beginning of the End of Big Tech - WIRED
articles.description: From politicians to VC firms, everyone is falling out of love with the massive, money-oriented, global technology titans. In their place, we have the chance to build something open and trustworthy.
articles.content: Next year will be Big Techs finale. Critique of Big Tech is now common sense, voiced by a motley spectrum that unites opposing political parties, mainstream pundits, and even tech titans such as the … [+2281 chars]
